It is good femdom; I would not have commented if I felt it below standard. And do not misinterpret my views - I see nothing wrong in a writer having written yaoi in the past. On a side note, your profile picture appears to be of a shirtless male figure undressing his trousers. I know not why you conceal it so, but there is no shame in having knowledge in yaoi - it is just another form of art by itself. Anyway, I did search for the artist's other works some time afterwards in hopes of finding more femdom, and instead found quite the collection of yaoi art, amusingly enough.
Even if they did write yaoi (which I have no knowledge of) this is still great femdom. How about dont try to psychoanalyze writers lmao

Interesting.. this seems to be a straight vanilla doujin drawn by a female artist.

A passing examination of the artstyle reveals much of its creator's fantasies - note the detail on the male character: the focus on defining his muscles, the crotch lining bearing the shape of his shaft beneath his undergarments.. followed by the complete lack of detail of the member as soon as it is revealed. An indication, alas, of limited knowledge of the masculine genital, perhaps a consequence of her frames of reference being limited to one's fantasies and other pornographic material.

Not to mention the plain but idealized appearance of the female character - clearly a feminine equivalent of the male self-insert stand-in as observed in male-drawn hentai, as though intended as a proxy for the artist herself.

Indeed, the fujo's devices betray her intentions. This may be a straight vanilla femdom doujin, but try as she might, she cannot hide years of drawing yaoi.
